solution_line_template: Janice takes {homework_time}/{room_cleaning_divisor} = <<{homework_time}/{room_cleaning_divisor}={room_cleaning_time}>>{room_cleaning_time} minutes to clean her room.
It takes {homework_time} + {dog_walk_extra_time} = <<{homework_time}+{dog_walk_extra_time}={dog_walking_time}>>{dog_walking_time} minutes for her to walk the dog.
It takes her {homework_time} x {trash_fraction} = <<{homework_time}*{trash_fraction}={trash_time}>>{trash_time} minutes to take out the trash.

So, it will take {homework_time} + {room_cleaning_time} + {dog_walking_time} + {trash_time} = <<{homework_time}+{room_cleaning_time}+{dog_walking_time}+{trash_time}={total_chore_time}>>{total_chore_time} minutes to do all those chores.

Since there are {minutes_per_hour} minutes in 1 hour, then {movie_duration_hours} hours is {movie_duration_hours} x {minutes_per_hour} = <<{movie_duration_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={movie_duration_minutes}>>{movie_duration_minutes} minutes.
Thus, Janice still has {movie_duration_minutes} - {total_chore_time} = <<{movie_duration_minutes}-{total_chore_time}={minutes_left}>>{minutes_left} minutes left before the movie starts.
